arc_stage: Stage 1 â€“ Desperation & doubt: feels rejected, frustrated, and believes she will never be good enough. No internship yet.
transcript: The anticipation has been overwhelming at times, and my anxiety has been running high. What if I am not good enough? What if I am rejected again? These thoughts have been lingering in the back of my mind for weeks now. I couldn't believe it. All my hard work, all my dedication, had paid off. The email read: "We are pleased to inform you that you have been selected for the internship...". My mentor, Angel James, has been a constant source of support and guidance throughout this process. I hope that makes sense. I'm not sure if I'm overthinking this. I'm trying not to overthink this too much. I've worked hard to get here. I just need to focus on the task at hand and trust that I'll do well. Cautiously optimistic?.

segments.text: The anticipation has been overwhelming at times, and my anxiety has been running high. What if I am not good enough? What if I am rejected again? These thoughts have been lingering in the back of my mind for weeks now.
I couldn't believe it. All my hard work, all my dedication, had paid off. The email read: "We are pleased to inform you that you have been selected for the internship...".
My mentor, Angel James, has been a constant source of support and guidance throughout this process. I hope that makes sense. I'm not sure if I'm overthinking this.
I'm trying not to overthink this too much. I've worked hard to get here. I just need to focus on the task at hand and trust that I'll do well. Cautiously optimistic?.

summary: The writer of the journal entry has been anxiously waiting for the outcome of an internship application process, but has finally received the news they had been hoping for: they have been selected for the internship. Despite initial worries about being "good enough," they are now feeling cautiously optimistic and focused on making the most of this new opportunity.
